required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Evaluation of Exenatide and Rosiglitazone in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: An Evaluation of the Metabolic Effects of Exenatide, Rosiglitazone, and Exenatide Plus Rosiglitazone in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Treated With Metformin

brief_summary.textblock: This protocol is designed to evaluate the metabolic effects of adding exenatide, rosiglitazone, or both to an existing regimen of metformin in subjects with inadequate glycemic control.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in ASIiAUC During a Hyperglycemic Clamp Test.
primary_outcome.description: Change in insulin incremental area under the concentration-time curve (ASIiAUC) from baseline to week 20. ASIiAUC is a measure of beta-cell function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in AUC for Glucose During a Meal Challenge Test (MCT).
secondary_outcome.description: Change in AUC(15-180 min) for glucose during a MCT baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Insulin Sensitivity Index as Measured by M-value.
secondary_outcome.description: Change of M-Value (mg/kg-min) during hyperinsulinemic euglycemic clamp test from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Insulin AUC in the First Stage From Baseline to Endpoint.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in insulin AUC in the first stage(uIU-min/ml) from baseline to week 20. "First stage" represents the first 10 minutes after reaching a steady state during a hyperglycemic clamp test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Insulin iAUC From Baseline to Endpoint.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in insulin iAUC in the first stage(uIU-min/ml) from baseline to week 20. "First stage" represents the first 10 minutes after reaching a steady state during a hyperglycemic clamp test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio (Value at Endpoint Divided by Value at Baseline) of AUC for Insulin During a Meal Challenge Test (MCT).
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio (value at endpoint divided by value at baseline) of AUC (15-180 min) for insulin (uIU-min/ml) during MCT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in AUC for C-peptide During a Meal Challenge Test (MCT).
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio (value at endpoint divided by value at baseline) of AUC(15-180 min) for C-peptide (nmol-min/L) during a MCT from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Incremental for Postprandial Glucose During a Meal Challenge Test (MCT).
secondary_outcome.description: Change in incremental for postprandial glucose (mmol/L) during a MCT from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Incremental for Postprandial Insulin During Meal Challenge Test (MCT).
secondary_outcome.description: Change in incremental for postprandial insulin (mmol/L) during meal challenge test (MCT) from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Incremental for Postprandial C-peptide During Meal Challenge Test (MCT).
secondary_outcome.description: Change in incremental for postprandial C-peptide (mmol/L) during MCT from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c
secondary_outcome.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Serum Glucose Concentration.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting serum glucose concentration from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting C-peptide
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting C-peptide from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Insulin
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting insulin from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Proinsulin
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio (endpoint value divided by baseline value) for fasting proinsulin, comparing endpoint (week 20) to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Weight
secondary_outcome.description: Change in body weight from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Total Cholesterol.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting total cholestrol from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting HDL Cholesterol
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting LDL Cholesterol
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Triglycerides
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio (endpint value divided by baseline value) of fasting triglycerides from baseline to week 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Percent Body Fat During a Meal Challenge Test (MCT)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in percent body fat from baseline to week 20, as assessed during an MCT

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Fat Mass During a Meal Challenge Test (MCT)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in body fat mass form baseline to week 20, as assessed during an MCT

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Lean Body Mass During a Meal Challenge Test (MCT)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in lean body mass from baseline to week 20, as assessed during an MCT

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Waist Circumference
secondary_outcome.description: Change in waist circumference from baseline to week 20

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Hip Circumference
secondary_outcome.description: Change in hip circumference form baseline to week 20

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Waist-to-hip Ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Change in waist-to-hip ratio (waist circumference divided by hip circumference) from baseline to week 20

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Hypoglycemia Events
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects experiencing hypoglycemia at any point during the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Hypoglycemia Rate Per 30 Days Per Patient
secondary_outcome.description: Average number of episodes of hypoglycemia per 30 days per patient

secondary_outcome.measure: Pedal Edema Score
secondary_outcome.description: Pedal edema scores experienced by each patient throughout the study ("1+" indicates a patient experienced a pedal edema score of 1 , 2, or 3; "2+" indicates a patient experienced a pedal edema score of 2 or 3, etc.) Scale: Slight pitting, no visible distortion, disappears rapidly A somewhat deeper pit than in 1+, but again no readily detectable distortion, and it disappears in 10 - 15 seconds The pit is noticeably deep and may last more than a minute; the dependent extremity looks fuller and swollen The pit is very deep, lasts as long as 2 - 5 minutes, and the dependent extremity is grossly distorted

intervention.description: subcutaneous injection, 5mcg or 10mcg, twice a day
oral tablet, 2mg or 4mg, twice a day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HbA1c of 6.8% to 10.0%, inclusive.
- Body mass index (BMI) of 25 kg/m^2 to 40 kg/m^2, inclusive.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have participated in this study previously, or have received exenatide, pramlintide acetate, GLP-1 analogs, or dipeptidyl peptidase-IV (DPP-IV) inhibitors
- Have participated in an interventional, medical, surgical, or pharmaceutical study (a study in which an experimental, drug, medical, or surgical treatment was given) within 30 days of study start. This criterion includes drugs that have not received regulatory approval for any indication at the time of study start.
- Treated with any of the following medications:
- Thiazolidinedione within 5 months of screening;
- Sulfonylurea within 3 months of screening;
- Metformin/sulfonylurea combination therapy within 3 months of screening;
- Alpha-glucosidase inhibitor within 3 months of screening;
- Meglitinide within 3 months of screening;
- Insulin for more than 1 week within the 3 months prior to screening.
- Symlin (pramlintide acetate) injection or Byetta (exenatide) injection at any time
- Chronic (more than 2 weeks) or recent (within 4 weeks of study start) use of a drug that directly affects gastrointestinal motility
- Are receiving chronic (lasting longer than 2 weeks) systemic glucocorticoid therapy (excluding topical and inhaled preparations) or have received such therapy within the 4 weeks immediately preceding study start
- Regular use of a medication with addictive potential such as an opiate, narcotic, or tranquilizer
- Systemic antineoplastic agent
- Systemic transplantation medication
- Drugs for weight loss, including over-the-counter medications, within the 4 months prior to study start

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Enrollment occurred between 18 October 2005 and 14 March 2008.

group.title: Exenatide
group.description: Exenatide 5 mcg twice a day (BID) for 4-weeks followed by exenatide 10 mcg BID for 16-weeks.

group.title: Exenatide Plus Rosiglitazone
group.description: Exenatide 5 mcg BID + rosiglitazone 2 mg BID for 4-weeks followed by exenatide 10 mcg + rosiglitazone 4 mg BID for 16-weeks.

group.title: Rosiglitazone
group.description: Rosiglitazone 2 mg BID for 4-weeks followed by rosiglitazone 4 mgs BID for 16-weeks.

group.description: Exenatide 5 mcg twice a day (BID) for 4-weeks followed by exenatide 10 mcg BID for 16-weeks.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change in ASIiAUC During a Hyperglycemic Clamp Test.
outcome.description: Change in insulin incremental area under the concentration-time curve (ASIiAUC) from baseline to week 20. ASIiAUC is a measure of beta-cell function.
outcome.population: All patients in full analysis set who participated in clamp test and have both baseline and endpoint measurement.

outcome.title: Pedal Edema Score
outcome.description: Pedal edema scores experienced by each patient throughout the study ("1+" indicates a patient experienced a pedal edema score of 1 , 2, or 3; "2+" indicates a patient experienced a pedal edema score of 2 or 3, etc.) Scale: Slight pitting, no visible distortion, disappears rapidly A somewhat deeper pit than in 1+, but again no readily detectable distortion, and it disappears in 10 15 seconds The pit is noticeably deep and may last more than a minute; the dependent extremity looks fuller and swollen The pit is very deep, lasts as long as 2 5 minutes, and the dependent extremity is grossly distorted
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set

group.title: Exenatide
group.description: Exenatide 5 mcg twice a day (BID) for 4-weeks followed by exenatide 10 mcg BID for 16-weeks.

group.title: Exenatide Plus Rosiglitazone
group.description: Exenatide 5 mcg BID + rosiglitazone 2 mg BID for 4-weeks followed by exenatide 10 mcg + rosiglitazone 4 mg BID for 16-weeks.

group.title: Rosiglitazone
group.description: Rosiglitazone 2 mg BID for 4-weeks followed by rosiglitazone 4 mgs BID for 16-weeks.

measure.title: Pedal Edema Score
measure.description: Pedal edema scores experienced by each patient throughout the study ("1+" indicates a patient experienced a pedal edema score of 1 , 2, or 3; "2+" indicates a patient experienced a pedal edema score of 2 or 3, etc.) Scale: Slight pitting, no visible distortion, disappears rapidly A somewhat deeper pit than in 1+, but again no readily detectable distortion, and it disappears in 10 15 seconds The pit is noticeably deep and may last more than a minute; the dependent extremity looks fuller and swollen The pit is very deep, lasts as long as 2 5 minutes, and the dependent extremity is grossly distorted
measure.population: Full Analysis Set

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
